meanings.definition: A type of exercise or assessment in which a passage is provided with certain words missing, to be filled in by the reader.
meanings.sent1: In class, the teacher gave us some clozes to complete by filling in the missing words.
meanings.sent2: The students enjoyed the clozes activity as it helped them practice their vocabulary.
meanings.sent3: The clozes were so tricky that even the smartest student struggled to fill in the blanks.
meanings.sent4: Completing the clozes felt like solving a puzzle, trying to find the right words to fit in.
meanings.sent5: The clozes exercise made learning fun and interactive for the students.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'cloze', referring to multiple instances of the exercise or assessment.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handed out several clozes for homework, each with different passages to complete.
meanings.sent2: The students collected all the clozes they had completed throughout the semester.
meanings.sent3: When the students saw the pile of clozes on their desks, they knew it was going to be a long night.
meanings.sent4: The clozes scattered around the classroom resembled pieces of a challenging word puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The multiple clozes provided ample practice for the students to improve their language skills.
